definitions.definition: An act or practice intended to deceive ; a trick .
examples: The whole conversation was merely a deceit .

definitions.definition: The state of being deceitful or deceptive .

The tort or fraudulent representation of a material fact made with knowledge of its falsity , or recklessly , or without reasonable grounds for believing its truth and with intent to induce reliance on it; the plaintiff justifiably relies on the deception, to his injury .

main_definition: An act or practice intended to deceive ; a trick .
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The state of being deceitful or deceptive .

( law ) The tort or fraudulent representation of a material fact made with knowledge of its falsity , or recklessly , or without reasonable grounds for believing its truth and with intent to induce reliance on it; the plaintiff justifiably relies on the deception, to his injury .
